## 사건 정보

**사건명**: Bert Davis v. State.
**판결일**: 1921-11-23
**법원**: Court of Criminal Appeals of Oklahoma
**관할**: Oklahoma, OK

**판사**: Bessey, Doyle, Matson

## 변호인

B. C. Wieck, for plaintiff in error., . S. P. Freeling, Atty. Gen., and W. C. Hall, Asst. Atty. Gen., for the State.

## 인용

- 201 P. 1001
- 20 Okla. Crim. 203

## 판결문 요약

Bert Davis, plaintiff in error, herein referred to as the defendant, was convicted on the 24th day of April, 1919, of the larceny of a Ford touring car, said to have been stolen early in the month of February, 1918. His *Page 205 
punishment was fixed at four years in the state penitentiary. After the overruling of a motion for a new trial, an appeal was taken and regularly lodged in this court.
The record shows that the subject of the larceny, a Ford touring car, was stolen from the residence of F.C. Hall at Chickasha, Okla., and that the car was afterwards found on the 20th day of February, 1918, in the possession of one Vince Cumiford, in Kay county, and that Cumiford had purchased the car from the defendant a short time previous. Mr. Hall, the owner of the car, went to the premises of Mr. Cumiford and identified the car to the satisfaction of Mr. Cumiford, who then surrendered it to Mr. Hall.
The defendant at this time was engaged in the shoe repairing business at Ponca City where he maintained a shop for that purpose.
